message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on cache-enabled heterogeneous networks and optimizing cache deployment to maximize network capacity while satisfying file transmission rate requirements. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper uses stochastic geometry analysis to obtain optimal cache sizes for MBSs and SBSs. This involves analyzing the information content of the network and falls under the scope of information theory.
3. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper discusses load balancing through inter-tier traffic steering, which involves distributing traffic across different base stations. This falls under the scope of distributed computing.
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper considers the deployment of cache instances at different base stations to provide guaranteed service in a cost-effective manner. This involves optimizing system performance and falls under the scope of systems and control.
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper discusses caching of popular and less popular files at different base stations. This involves handling multimedia content and falls under the scope of multimedia.
